What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain
Comments_List: I learned a lot about the basic optics and microscopy techniques. We learned the theory and the practical aspects of using the microscope in investigating cell biological questions.
I gained valuable information about multiple imaging/microscopy techniques. This information will help me select appropriate methods for my future experiments, and process the data in a robust way.
I learned a TON of practical and theoretical knowledge about a wide range of imaging methods.
Knowledge of the anatomy of a general microscope, the uses and advantages of each microscope, mechanisms of fluorescence activation, etc.

How to take "good" images for microscopy, the variety of microscopy tools available to me and how to choose which tool to apply towards my own research. The course has helped me make well informed decisions during my own confocal imaging experiments (i.e. avoid saturation, maintain consistent imaging conditions).

It is a great class where experts of each microscopy technique will share their insight and experience. Not only is it well-grounded theoretically but students also get to see the real microscopes and apply the learned knowledge on site.
I like the atmosphere of the class. It is both rigorous and relaxed. I think this is allowed by the small class size. The instructors are fantastic. I think

Strengths: Covers a ton of relevant information that I can actually use in the lab
Weaknesses: Some of the lectures were taught too quickly for the complexity of the topic being covered
Could be improved by adding a ImageJ homework to give a hands on example of using the ImageJ methods Dr. Shao taught.
More student engagement within each course meeting may encourage active participation
I definitely would. I hope any students who will have to work with microscopes would take this course.

I would recommend this to students who are serious about improving their microscopy skills. The amount of information to be gathered from this course will probably depend on motivation and mental effort. For these people, I think this course is extremely valuable.

I think that any student who is going to use imaging in their research should take this class because otherwise a lot of people won't take the time to actually learn the fundamentals of how the scopes work and will instead just mess with things until they get a pretty picture.
Yes - very useful for our research.

Yes, if the student wants to apply microscopy in their own thesis project, then I think this class is almost essential. It is much easier to learn all the information through instructors rather than read it through texts, which may take a lot longer and may not cover all the necessary details required to make well informed decisions in microscopy
